description: Federal officials are urging risk assessments for dozens of bridges across 19 states, saying that the Maryland Transportation Authority failed to perform such an evaluation before the Francis Scott Key Bridge collapsed nearly a year ago.
title: Maryland officials failed to assess vulnerability of Francis Scott Key Bridge before collapse, NTSB says

description: Consumers should brace for borrowing costs to stay elevated, prices to rise and stock markets to remain on edge for at least a little longer, analysts say.
title: Ways to spend — and save — as interest rates stay high and tariffs mount

description: With questions about the Department of Education's future still unanswered, learn more about could happen if the agency is dismantled.
title: What to expect after Trump's Department of Education executive order

description: Democrats are responding to calls at town halls to more forcefully push back against President Donald Trump — and how one lawmaker is stepping into the party’s leadership void.
title: Democrats feel the heat at town halls, too: From the Politics Desk

description: After sinking more than a quarter-billion dollars into the 2024 election and then taking a central role in President Donald Trump’s administration, billionaire Elon Musk is demonstrating that he’s not done with his efforts to reshape American politics.
title: New political spending signals Elon Musk's huge role in the GOP is still growing

description: Two families have been awarded $750,000 after a jury ruled that the owner of a Virginia campground discriminated against them because one of the campers was a Black man.
title: Jury says Virginia campground must pay 2 families $750,000 for discrimination against Black camper

description: A proposal that would require educational institutions that house students overnight to separate bathrooms “by immutable biological sex” is headed to Tennessee Gov. Bill Lee’s desk.
title: New anti-transgender bathroom bill is headed to Tennessee governor's desk

description: President Trump signed an executive order directing Education Secretary Linda McMahon to begin dismantling the Department of Education, calling for Congress to support its full elimination.
title: Trump signs executive order aiming to dismantle Department of Education

description: A former NFL and university football coach was charged in a 24-count indictment after allegedly accessing the digital accounts of 3,300 students to download their intimate photos and videos.
title: Ex-Michigan football coach allegedly stole intimate photos from over 3,000 student accounts

description: A federal judge Thursday blasted the Justice Department's latest response to his demand for more information about deportation flights that were carried out under a wartime law known as the Alien Enemies Act as "woefully insufficient."
title: Judge rips DOJ's 'woefully insufficient' response to questions on Alien Enemies Act case

description: Scientists are homing in on the nature of dark energy. The big question is whether it's a constant force, which scientists have long thought, or whether the force is weakening.
title: How will the universe end? A changing understanding of dark energy may provide a new answer

description: Trump signed an executive order directing Education Secretary Linda McMahon to dismantle the department. Complete elimination would require congressional approval.
title: Trump signs executive order to dismantle the Education Department

description: Judge Ellen Hollander said DOGE is "essentially engaged in a fishing expedition" and its methods are like "hitting a fly with a sledgehammer."
title: Federal judge blocks DOGE's access to Social Security records in blistering ruling

description: The Trump administration has accomplished academics in its crosshairs — and may be trying to make examples of them.
title: The scholars targeted for deportation by the Trump administration

description: The founder of Pirate’s Booty Snacks lost his chaotic bid for mayor of a tiny New York community after claiming that he was the village leader and had the authority to replace the entire local government, officials said Thursday.
title: Pirate's Booty founder stages Long Island mutiny, declares he's mayor and tries to fire village staff

description: Schumer said during an interview with "Meet the Press" that "democracy is at risk" following Trump’s attacks on the judiciary and calls to impeach a judge who ruled against him.
title: Chuck Schumer says a 'lawless' Trump has caused a constitutional crisis

description: A Southwest Airlines flight nearly took off from a Florida taxiway on Thursday before an air traffic controller stopped the potentially dangerous departure, officials said.
title: Southwest flight tried to take off from Florida taxiway after crew mistook it for runway

description: A fan threw a water bottle on the court late in Thursday’s first-round NCAA Tournament game between the Creighton Bluejays and Louisville Cardinals, causing a brief delay.
title: Fan throws water bottle on court in closing moments of Creighton-Louisville

description: In an exclusive interview with Meet the Press, Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer tells Kristen Welker he believes America is in a constitutional crisis amid President Trump’s calls to impeach a judge who ruled against him over his deportation efforts.
title: Schumer says America is in a constitutional crisis: ‘Our democracy is at risk’

description: A Florida woman was arrested after police said she drowned her dog in an Orlando airport bathroom so she could board a plane.
title: Woman accused of drowning dog in Orlando airport bathroom so she could board plane

description: A former maintenance technician has filed a lawsuit saying he had raised safety concerns about the free-fall ride at a Florida amusement park month before a Missouri teenager fell off and plunged to his death in 2022.
title: Maintenance technician claims he flagged safety issues with Free Fall ride before teen plunged to his death

description: About 80 Tesla vehicles at a car dealership in Canada were damaged, authorities said, as the United States Attorney General announced charges Thursday against three people accused of using Molotov cocktails to set fire to Tesla cars and charging stations.
title: 3 people face federal charges in Tesla arson attacks

description: Netflix's “Adolescence" follows the fallout after a teenage boy is arrested for murdering his female classmate.
title: How toxic masculinity, Andrew Tate and the online 'manosphere' inspired 'Adolescence'

description: The base’s frustration with the party has mounted following the government funding fight, as Democratic lawmakers seek distance from Chuck Schumer.
title: Democrats face demands to step up their opposition to Trump at fiery town halls

description: Federal immigration agents arrested Georgetown graduate student Badar Khan Suri outside his Arlington home, alleging he actively spread Hamas propaganda. His student visa was revoked, according to his attorney.
title: Georgetown graduate student arrested for allegedly spreading Hamas propaganda

description: "Pawn Stars" star Rick Harrison opened up about processing grief after losing his son to a drug overdose last year.
title: 'Pawn Stars' star Rick Harrison opens up about death of son: 'Nothing worse than losing a kid'

description: Tesla is recalling more than 46,000 of its Cybertrucks due to a cosmetic exterior trim panel that it said can “delaminate and detach from the vehicle,” potentially becoming a road hazard and “increasing the risk of a crash.”
title: Tesla recalls 46,000 Cybertrucks, citing exterior panel that it says can increase ‘risk of crash’

description: Judge James Boasberg ordered the government to provide information by noon today.
title: DOJ misses deadline to provide answers on deportation flights

description: A smiling selfie of Bryan Kohberger with a thumbs-up pose taken hours after four University of Idaho students were killed in 2022 may be introduced at his murder trial, prosecutors said in a series of court filings released Thursday.
title: Why prosecutors want selfie of Idaho college murders' suspect shown at trial

description: A Minnesota state senator who was caught in a sting operation resigned under fire Thursday after he was charged with soliciting a minor for prostitution.
title: Minnesota state senator resigns after he was charged with soliciting a minor for prostitution

description: An LGBTQ club in Sacramento, California, is banning all "MAGA-related attire" after a patron wore a "Make America Great Again" hat to the popular venue.
title: Popular Sacramento LGBTQ club bans all MAGA gear

description: Andre Butts, one of the men who participated in a drugging and robbery scheme of gay men that killed two people, was sentenced on Thursday to eight years in state prison.
title: Man who drugged and robbed men in NYC gay bar murders sentenced to 8 years

description: LARAMIE, Wyo. — Republican Rep. Harriet Hageman faced a torrent of heckles and boos during a town hall in deep red Wyoming as she repeatedly tried to downplay constituents' concerns about the Trump administration's actions.
title: GOP lawmaker booed at town hall for saying crowd is 'obsessed' with the government

description: After nine long months of waiting, TikToker Daryn Wilmore finally got to say something she’s dreamed of for the better part of a year: Her father, NASA astronaut Barry “Butch” Wilmore, is no longer stuck in space.
title: NASA astronaut's daughter celebrates dad's return after 9 months stuck in space

description: Investors have closely watched Nvidia’s week-long GPU Technology Conference (GTC) for news and updates from the dominant maker of chips that power artificial intelligence applications.
title: Nvidia's CEO did a Q&A with analysts. What he said and what Wall Street thinks about it

description: The Taliban has released George Glezman, an American citizen detained in Afghanistan for more than two years. NBC News' Aaron Gilchrist reports that Glezzman was held without charges or accusations of wrongdoing.
title: Taliban releases American detainee held in Afghanistan

description: During a town hall in Laramie, Wyo., Republican Rep. Harriet Hageman was met with repeated boos as she attempted to discuss her support of the government funding bill passed by Congress and DOGE's actions.
title: GOP Rep. Hageman booed at town hall: 'You guys are going to have a heart attack'

description: Slightly more Americans applied for unemployment benefits last week, but layoffs remain historically low.
title: Applications for jobless benefits inch up, but layoffs remain low, labor market healthy

description: Carrie Underwood and Randy Travis shared a sweet moment at the “Opry 100: A Live Celebration.”
title: Carrie Underwood and Randy Travis move country fans to tears during ‘Opry 100’ special tribute

description: Whether you choose a fan favorite or go all in on a Cinderella story, trying to create the perfect March Madness bracket is now a yearly tradition.
title: The March Madness bracket may have started at a Staten Island pub

description: William Chisholm, a Massachusetts native and lifelong fan, will purchase the historic NBA franchise.
title: Celtics to be sold to private equity co-founder for $6 billion, reports say

description: Stock market dips can create a big portfolio risk during your earlier retirement years — and many investors don’t prepare, financial experts say.
title: There's a 'danger zone' for retirees when the stock market dips. How to shield your portfolio.

description: Klarna, the buy now, pay later lender that’s headed for an initial public offering, said on Thursday that it’s signed on DoorDash as a partner, another sign of momentum for public market investors.
title: Klarna lands buy now, pay later deal with DoorDash, notching another win ahead of IPO

description: Sales of previously owned homes in February rose 4.2% from January to 4.26 million units on a seasonally adjusted, annualized basis, according to the National Association of Realtors.
title: February home resales jump much more than expected, despite higher mortgage rates

description: Two men held in custody by immigration authorities fled from detention near Denver after a jail's electrical power gave out and inadvertently their doors to freedom, officials said Wednesday.
title: ICE detainees flee from custody in Colorado after reported power outage

description: Darden Restaurants on Thursday reported weaker-than-expected sales as Olive Garden and LongHorn Steakhouse underperformed analysts’ projections.
title: Darden Restaurants sales disappoint as Olive Garden, LongHorn Steakhouse miss expectations

description: McALESTER, Okla. — Oklahoma prepared to execute a man on Thursday for fatally shooting a woman during a home-invasion robbery 20 years ago.
title: Oklahoma to execute a man who killed a woman in a 2005 random home invasion robbery

description: Scientists are urging people who live in southcentral Alaska to begin preparing for a possible eruption of the Mount Spurr volcano.
title: Eruption at Alaska's Mount Spurr is likely and scientists say preparations should begin

description: NBC’s Steve Kornacki joins TODAY to break down all things March Madness, including some of the most exciting storylines to watch out for and the very low odds of filling out a perfect bracket.
title: Steve Kornacki previews 2025 March Madness, teams to watch

description: Watch live coverage as President Trump holds an education event at the White House and signs an executive order that could lead to the dismantling of the Department of Education.
title: Trump signs executive order dismantling the Department of Education

description: Spring is off to a furious start for several parts of the country after a blizzard dumped over a foot of snow and tornadoes razed through neighborhoods in the Midwest, as the same storm system moves east and is set to drench the East Coast.
title: Ten million under winter weather alerts on first day of spring after a blizzard and tornadoes pummel Midwest

description: Donald Trump is expected to sign an executive order to close the Education Department.
title: Trump targets Education Department and Steve Kornacki's NCAA picks: Morning Rundown

description: As retailers like Target and Amazon announce plans to scale back or cut DEI programs in their businesses, Black customers are rethinking where they spend their cash.
title: As retailers drop DEI, some Black customers drop them

description: A jury on Wednesday ordered environmental campaign group Greenpeace to pay more than $660 million in damages to Texas-based oil company Energy Transfer, the developer of the Dakota Access Pipeline.
title: Greenpeace ordered to pay more than $660 million over Dakota Access Pipeline protests

description: A three-year-old girl is clinging to life after suffering a gunshot wound to the head while inside a car parked outside Hunt County Regional Medical Center, according to Greenville police.
title: Police: Mother says rifle inside car ‘went off’ hitting 3-year-old in the head

description: The Pentagon restored some webpages highlighting the crucial wartime contributions of Navajo Code Talkers and other Native American veterans on Wednesday, days after tribes condemned the action.
title: Pentagon restores histories of Navajo Code Talkers, other Native veterans after public outcry

description: Steve Kornacki gives his Cinderella teams, upset picks and Final Four selections as the NCAA Tournament gets underway.
title: Steve Kornacki's Guide to the NCAA Tournament

description: Ocasio-Cortez is hitting the road with Bernie Sanders this week as even once-skeptical Democrats seek to elevate the progressive star in their fight against Trump.
title: Democrats are desperately searching for new leaders. AOC is stepping into the void.

description: Anti-vaccine influencers use a 6-year-old's measles death to promote debunked theories, while health experts warn of the danger of the disease.
title: How the anti-vaccine movement weaponized a 6-year-old’s measles death

description: Former Vice President Al Gore championed the development of the internet so enthusiastically that one of the first myths of the online era was that he claimed to have invented it.
title: Inside Vance's unfiltered 'err on the side of openness' social media presence

description: A Florida man who killed an 8-year-old girl and her grandmother on a night in which he drank heavily and used drugs is set to be executed Thursday.
title: Florida man faces execution for the killing of an 8-year-old girl and her grandmother

description: Federal immigration authorities have detained a Georgetown University graduate student from India who was teaching at the Washington, D.C., institution on a student visa, his attorney said Wednesday.
title: Georgetown University graduate student detained by immigration authorities

description: A failed Republican candidate was found guilty Wednesday of hiring people to shoot at the homes of local Democratic leaders after he lost an election for the New Mexico House of Representatives, according to his attorney.
title: Failed candidate found guilty in shooting plot against New Mexico Democrats

description: A former Georgia warehouse worker for the Augusta National Golf Club was sentenced to one year in prison Wednesday for transporting millions of dollars’ worth of stolen Masters tournament memorabilia, including one of Arnold Palmer’s iconic green jackets.
title: Georgia man sentenced to 1 year in theft of Arnold Palmer green jacket, other Masters memorabilia

description: Around $3 billion will be bet on men's and women’s NCAA basketball tournaments. NBC News’ Steve Kornacki reports on what teams could go far and possible upsets ahead of the games.
title: Big board with Steve Kornacki: NCAA basketball bracket
